title: 113_hr5218
content: The Act titled the "Everson Walls and Ron Springs Gift for Life Act of 2014" establishes a National Organ and Tissue Donor Registry Resource Center under the Public Health Service Act. The "Everson Walls and Ron Springs Gift for Life Act of 2014" establishes a National Organ and Tissue Donor Registry Resource Center (referred to as the 'Center') to advance the development, expansion, and evaluation of State organ and tissue donor registries, facilitate timely access to donor information, ensure compliance with operating standards, and provide technical assistance to States. The "Everson Walls and Ron Springs Gift for Life Act of 2014" establishes a National Organ and Tissue Donor Registry Resource Center to support State organ and tissue registries, maintain a registry information clearinghouse, and authorize appropriations of $5,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2015 to 2019. The "Everson Walls and Ron Springs Gift for Life Act of 2014" establishes a National Organ and Tissue Donor Registry Resource Center to support State organ and tissue registries. Additionally, grants are provided for State organ and tissue donor registries under section 371C of the Public Health Service Act. The Secretary awards grants to eligible entities for State organ and tissue donor registries. Eligible entities must use funds to develop and maintain registries, establish improvement benchmarks, and adhere to operating standards. The tissue donor registry must allow donors to include statements about anatomical gifts, be accessible to organ procurement organizations, operate 24/7, and protect personally identifiable information. The tissue donor registry must protect personally identifiable information and require consent for any use or disclosure. Entities seeking grants must submit applications to the Secretary, and recipients must report on activities funded every 180 days. Entities receiving grants must submit reports to the Secretary detailing the use of funds and assessing initiatives for replication in other states. $10,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2015 to 2019 for this purpose. SEC. 4. LIMITATION ON LIABILITY. Amends the Public Health Service Act to limit civil liability for harvesting organs without consent if the individual is registered as a donor. SEC. 5. STUDY ON FEASIBILITY OF ESTABLISHING A LIVING DONOR DATABASE. SEC. 5. STUDY ON FEASIBILITY OF ESTABLISHING A LIVING DONOR DATABASE. Amends the Public Health Service Act to study the feasibility of creating a living donor database to track health effects of organ donors.
